intro: Oreosyce villosa, commonly known as the hairy oreosyce, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Oreosyce villosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories.
